title: Institutional Research Analyst Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Vassar College
Interview Descriptions: Nice and personal interview process with the supervisor of the role and also higher ups of the institution. Some phone screens and then a trip to the university. The campus was beautiful and the people were very cordial
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in working at Vassar?

title: Librarian Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Vassar College
Interview Descriptions: The university did a Zoom preliminary interview and then stopped answering all emails from myself until they had hired someone else. The preliminary interview was pretty quick, but they did not have a lot of flexibility with schedule.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Adjunct Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Vassar College (Poughkeepsie, NY) in Apr 2022
Interview Descriptions: Timely.  Started and ended on time. People were very nice.   Everyone got a chance to ask a question. Every question I had was answered. Results were emailed in a timely fashion.
Interview Questions: These questions are very confidential..

title: Fraud Investigator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Vassar College
Interview Descriptions: Really enjoyed some of the people, but lots of the faculty members were terribly arrogant.  The day felt a bit rushed, but about three employees (all women) were on top of it.
Interview Questions: Who do you think is the typical Vassar student?

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Vassar College
Interview Descriptions: I was interviewed remotely by a committee of 10 professors.  This was conducted via Zoom.  It took about an hour.  The committee circulated questions, which were mostly directed at my vision for the courses, but also regarding my research and how it fit within the broader department.
Interview Questions: What would your course look like?

title: Printer Technician Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Vassar College
Interview Descriptions: Easy pee zee, they just asked me abt the basics of a printer and I nailed it. Just know the different brands of ink and you should be set. Also paper knowledge.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to be a printer technician?

title: Assistant Teacher Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Vassar College (Poughkeepsie, NY) in May 2020
Interview Descriptions: It was just a phone call, good communication with the organization, and started basically right away.  There was only one person on the call and it was pretty straight forward.
Interview Questions: Explain how you have had experience in the past

title: Vassar Ford Scholar Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Vassar College (Poughkeepsie, NY) in Feb 2020
Interview Descriptions: After the application I got one 30-minute long interview with the professor in their office.  Interview is taken place in the spring semester usually before the Spring break. You get to know the results after couple of weeks.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in academia/research?

title: Faculty Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Vassar College (Poughkeepsie, NY) in May 2018
Interview Descriptions: I was offered the position after getting to know the professor in class and coming to office hours. Most faculty research assistant positions are offered to students that the professors have become familiar with through coursework.
Interview Questions: Do you have experience with Microsoft Suite?

title: Lab Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Vassar College
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was painless.  I met with the chair of the department, people who I would work directly with and my future boss.   They were able to explain in detail what I would be doing and gave me a tour of the facility.
Interview Questions: Did I have experience working the Mac products or just PC?

title: Student Affairs Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at Vassar College
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted by email for a phone interview with the director of the office I was applying to. I was informed that the process is a phone screen, then a skype interview, then an on campus interview.
Interview Questions: What are you reading?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Vassar College (Poughkeepsie, NY)
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and got a call back 3 or 4 weeks later offering me an interview. The interview was on campus the following week. During the interview, I spoke with a panel of members of the department I was interested in working in. It was an hour or so long and consisted of a brief overview of my work experience and education followed by a series of behavioral interview questions. They do request, and check, references.  I was offered the job a week or so after the interview.
Interview Questions: Describe situations where you had to deal with a difficult coworker, customer, and supervisor and how you handled them.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Vassar College (Poughkeepsie, NY) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: Meet with the Professor and shared interest in what type of research I had previously done or am currently doing with another faculty member. It is more of a relaxed conversation about why you want to do research and not necessarily what you know technically on how to do certain procedures.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this research ? What research do you like?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Vassar College (Poughkeepsie, NY) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: Above all, the professor will want to hear about your coursework and how you engaged with it. Tell them about a project or topic you went above and beyond on. Tell them about your future aspirations and emphasize that you have goals - you just don't have a ladder to get to them.
Interview Questions: What has been your favorite class at Vassar so far?

title: Office of International Services Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Vassar College (Poughkeepsie, NY) in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: 2 rounds of interview. First with a few current interns, then with the director and office assistant. Questions primarily revolve around the experience of being an international student, accounts relevant to solving a challenging problem, views on the international community and ways of engaging the domestic students from a global perspective
Interview Questions: Describe one thing you would bring to the international community if you were chosen as an intern?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Vassar College (Poughkeepsie, NY)
Interview Descriptions: Applied Online and was Interviewed by a Professor of the corresponding Department I applied to. The meeting took place in a nice environment, which made me feel very comfortable. The Professor/Interviewer himself was also very friendly, making the interview seem more like a conversation which was nice.
Interview Questions: Q: Why did you apply for this position?

title: Phonathon Caller Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Vassar College
Interview Descriptions: I had to apply online and then I had an interview with the managers. It was not that difficult and I thought the questions were very relevant to the position.
Interview Questions: How would you ask for a donation?

title: Assistant Coach Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Vassar College (Poughkeepsie, NY) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: 1 interview, sit down w head coach and other assistant coach. Nothing hard just asked me about my experiences and schedule, whether I knew if I wanted to be a coach for life or just a year
Interview Questions: Not really questions. Just a chat

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Vassar College
Interview Descriptions: While there is an online form to select positions you might be interested in. Being a professor's research assistant requires actually meeting with the professor first and sending an email of interest to them.  Important to network and get to know which professors you might want to work with instead of shooting in the dark.
Interview Questions: Do you know how to [insert obscure research/office skill here] ?

title: Undergraduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Vassar College in May 2014
Interview Descriptions: Just one interview, interviewers were relatively friendly but extremely professional. The first portion of the interview consists of questions related to your resume and personal history and the second portion of the interview has to do more with how you would handle various scenarios. There were two interviewers in the room
Interview Questions: What sets you apart?

title: Academic Intern Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Vassar College
Interview Descriptions: No interviews are required for this position. Students are selected to become interns after performing well in a particular class.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: IT Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Vassar College (Poughkeepsie, NY) in Nov 2013
Interview Descriptions: I posted my application via the https://employment.vassar.edu site for a temporary (6+ month) position as IT Project Manager.  Within a couple of days, I was contacted to set up a 30 minutes telephone screening interview, which took place about a week or so after I applied.  The CIO and his direct reports all asked questions during the phone interview.  About 2 weeks later, I got a phone call informing me that I was not selected.
Interview Questions: As IT project manager, how would I handle a situation where a significant phase of a VoIP deployment was delayed due to a failed relationship with the vendor and a new vendor was being brought on board?

title: Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Vassar College
Interview Descriptions: What drew you to this position? What other commitments do you have? When are you available?
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Costume Shop Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Vassar College (Poughkeepsie, NY) in Apr 2013
Interview Descriptions: I sat down with the head of the costume department and discussed the position. The head of the costumes department already knew me, so she wanted to inform me of the duties of the position. She had me in mind for the specific position and wanted to know how I felt about taking on the responsibility.
Interview Questions: How do you feel about coming in early on Saturdays and Sundays in order to work during tech week?

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Vassar College (Poughkeepsie, NY) in Oct 2012
Interview Descriptions: Full day of interviews with delightful faculty and administrators. Tour of campus. Discussion with a few students upon my request. Lots of interest in my research. My talk was intimidating but felt like a graduate workshop not like diss defense
Interview Questions: What is your next research project after your dissertation?

title: Institutional Research Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Vassar College in Apr 2011
Interview Descriptions: To be honest, the most difficult part of the application process was discovering that Vassar spent the time to partake in well-documented Institutional Research. The school often portrays a calm nonchalance regarding its status as a "highly rated" institution, with the apparent intent to ignore said rankings. However, the school remains entrenched in the war of college ranks and is often looking for interns if you ask.
Interview Questions: How would you describe the "typical" Vassar student?
